title: Love Island's Olivia and Alex Bowen named show's richest ever stars
text:
The Love Island couple have amassed a fortune of over £4 million (Picture: ITV/Getty)

Love Island’s Olivia and Alex Bowen have been revealed as the show’s richest ever stars – with combined earnings of over £4 million.

The couple – who met on the second series of the show in 2016 – have made more bank than any other contestant featured on the show through a combination of deals with clothing brands and appearences on both TV and the club circuit.

The former sales executive and scaffolder tied the knot in 2018, two years after meeting on the ITV reality show, where they placed second after Cara Delahoyde and Nathan Massey.

Olivia and Alex first met on the second series of Love Island in 2016 (Picture: ITV)

According to Heat Magazine, the two made bank thanks to Olivia’s presenting deal with This Morning and clothing brand with Quiz, as well as Alex’s modelling contracts with brands such as boohooMAN and Gym King. The Brummie boy also apparently nets £500,000 a year from club appearances on the PA circuit, which isn’t bad going at all.

Advertisement

Advertisement

In true influencer style, they also managed to seriously monetise their nuptials, with a £25,000 magazine deal for exclusive rights to the big day, as well as a series of reality shows on TLC.

Their combined earnings mean the couple are earning more than other established Love Island stars – including former winners Dani Dyer and Kem Cetinay.

The two may very well have competition soon, though, as this year’s Love Island stars are only just starting to make serious coin. Winner Amber Gill was named Love Island’s most bankable star after bagging a £1 million deal with clothing brand Miss Pap.

Unfortunately, however, there isn’t such a happy ending for another Love Island couple – Jourdan Riane has apparently dumped Danny Williams after catching him flirting with other girls.

description: Olivia and Alex Bowen have been named the richest Love Island stars after amassing a fortune of over £4 million.
